timeline.message: Removing unaccepted characters from file names

timeline.bodyText:
This looks a bit weird. Why aren't we defining component and data directly? Along the lines of just
path: 'about',
component: AboutUsComponent,
data: {
    authorities: [],
    pageTitle: 'aboutUs',
},
timeline.author: FrankeLukas

replies.bodyText: Yes you are right, its weird. I started it with the idea I would need path children and forgot to adjust it later when it was not needed. Ill change it now
replies.author: kriststoja

timeline.author: stefanwaldhauser

timeline.bodyText: Just out of interest. Why are you doing this with a tap operator here and not in the subscribe part?
timeline.author: stefanwaldhauser

replies.bodyText:
As I wrote below, this part was only imported from the footer component since some parts of it were moved inside about us page. I could give an assumption why it was done like this, but wouldnt be the answer of the one who did it :)
As for the email address it would be the same answer. I gave the benefit of the doubt it is correct, if not it has been for a long time wrong and I could fix it with this case
replies.author: kriststoja

timeline.bodyText: Just trying to learn more about rxjs: Why are you doing this here? Is it possible that getProfileInfo sends undefined?
timeline.author: stefanwaldhauser

replies.bodyText:
Small explanation. This implementation here, together with the method set contact() are not done by me. They were implemented on footer component, but since Report a bug, Request a feature and Contact us are now inside the about page, I had to take this logic with in this component. I didnt overanalyze this part and gave the benefit of the doubt that when they were implemented back then, they have already been checked. That would be an answer also to the previous 2 comments.
As for rxjs question: getProfileInfo() here is a BehaviourSubject, an Observable used to stream data. We can subscribe to it and it always delivers immediately the latest data when data changes. The good of it is it will always send a valid value, even if no data has been emitted, thats why the risk of an error because of the undefined is eleminated. Thats why BehaviourSubjects are normaly initiated with undefined or null values (or empty values in general). It is actually also very good when you want to render the html parts only when data is there, not before, and can use BehaviourSubjetcs with async pipe to make sure of it.
replies.author: kriststoja

timeline.message: Merge branch 'develop' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into about-us
Merge branch 'about-us' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into about-us

timeline.bodyText: Please lazy-load this module OR make this part of another module we already have.
timeline.author: jpbernius

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need two modules? One should be enough? (And only if we end up lazy loading, otherwise this should not be needed at all for a single component.
timeline.author: jpbernius
jpbernius
jpbernius

timeline.bodyText: Is this ordered in any particular order? What about a random order on each pageload?
